text: can anyone tell me please , how to import a word file in android studio and then split(tokenize) it to save in database in  different fields
what do you need from this word file - just plain text?
it’s a proprietary format, so if you can export it to txt you’ll have way less hassle.

text is like that in word file ....                   1.1.here is text                                                                                                              i just want to save 1 in first field and next 1 in second field and text in third field??
zmarkan??

save it to a regular text file (not Word, because it is not possible to read Word files easily) and then look at this: <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16672074/import-csv-file-to-sqlite-in-android>

attachments.title: Import .csv file to Sqlite in Android
attachments.text: I have a .csv file and I want to import this file putting into my database in android. Example, the .csv file: | id | name | dt1 | dt2 | dt3 | | 1 | Paul | 21 | 98 | 91 | | 2 | John | 22...
attachments.fallback: Import .csv file to Sqlite in Android

text: <@U0SB9LY84>: post a snippet of the word file

I’m now using ExoPlayer to play those videos, but I cannot buffer next video when the current video is playing
So it can’t look like one video,
There is delay when switch between two videos
Any one has solution for this, please?
<@U0SB9LY84|rajarehan> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/rajarehan/F0SR9VBGS/111111.png|@aki:>
so you want to separate it in two parts? The number and the text?
a) you’ll need to export that file from doc to a plain text format, like txt.
There's Apache POI lib to handle Word files
but do you need that in an app?
are you supposed to load different files
yup <@U09T8SFG8>  <@U053PPGDC>  after separating  i want to save them in different fields in sqlite
It's not really worth it to use POI for this, like zmarkan says put everything in a text file then right a script to replace the first space with `,"` and the newline character with `"\n`
then you can import to sqlite from csv

<@U0SB9LY84>: for sqlite there’s quite a lot of resources on <http://d.android.com|d.android.com>. You just need to iterate over lines in this document, split the items, and insert these in the DB

<@U0MT01V44>: Here is your process in n easy steps

1. You export the word file as some text format
2. Write a script to turn that in to CSV by replacing first space with `,”` and last space with `”\n`
3. Parse the file in your code and create an object
4. Insert object into sqlite using ORM or sqlite code that you would normally use
Couldn’t be easier

text: <@U0QR1SM32>: yeah tried, and it solves those issues that are shown int he video, not this one tho

Ladies and Gentleman, heres the deal: On the following scenario: a Fragment that uses both MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) and the DataBinding framework.

I have a RecyclerView that has an Adapter for N ViewModels which hold an instance for the actual Model.

When I click on my View, through Databinding it reflects to my "startDownload" method on my ViewModel. Thats ok till now. My "startDownload" is called from the ViewModel, passing to the "doDownload" method my Model instance. How should I work here that, if my model changes (I'm downloading something so I want the totalDownloadedBytes to be refreshed
`notifyPropertyChanged()`?
Rx all the things
You could use a timer to update every N ms…
<@U08GFT5V5>: what’s that?, in the rxandroid package?
databinding framework
<@U08GFT5V5>: :O
check <http://developer.android.com/tools/data-binding/guide.html#data_objects>

attachments.title: Data Binding Guide | Android Developers
attachments.text: This document explains how to use the Data Binding Library to write declarative layouts and minimize the glue code necessary to bind your application logic and layouts. The Data Binding Library offers both flexibility and broad compatibility — it'…

Is it considered good or bad practive to have an `RecyclerView` inside a `RecyclerView` ?
<@U0MHZ10FN>: a scrollable view can be inside another scrollable view?

Well I have a big RecyclerView with multiple different item types and on one of them I need to display a small preview of an image album (basically a 2x4 grid of images). I could use GridView or another RecyclerView (that one has fixed size) and GridLayoutManager

well, sorry <@U0MHZ10FN> . I cannot give any ideas. I haven’t faced it before. I thought you can do with a big RecyclerView in LinearLayoutManger, Vertical direction and the child content will be a RecyclerView, in Horizontal.
No worries yeah the thing is I don’t need scrolling I just need a grid

oops, so go with 1 RecyclerView and the ViewHolder is a CardView or a layout with 2x4 views inside (you can custom that view). if more row or columns, we can add views to it. in my view, I don’t prefer to use RecyclerView then put inside it a scrollable view
